meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization was monotheistic, worshipping a single deity.
meanings.sent2: Many people follow a monotheistic religion, such as Christianity or Islam.
meanings.sent3: The monotheistic priest accidentally prayed to the wrong god, causing a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: In a world of many beliefs, her monotheistic perspective stood out like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monotheistic faith can be both comforting and challenging for believers.

meanings.definition: Relating to the belief in only one god.
meanings.sent1: The monotheistic teachings emphasized the importance of unity in faith.
meanings.sent2: Monotheistic symbols can be found in various religious artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The monotheistic artwork depicted a whimsical scene of the lone deity playing with the stars.
meanings.sent4: Her monotheistic necklace shone brightly, symbolizing her devotion to a singular god.
meanings.sent5: The monotheistic architecture of the temple reflected the simplicity and purity of the faith.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the worship of only one god.
meanings.sent1: The monotheistic rituals were solemn and reverent, honoring the single divine being.
meanings.sent2: Monotheistic prayers were offered daily in the sacred temple.
meanings.sent3: The monotheistic ceremony included a playful dance to entertain the deity.
meanings.sent4: His monotheistic devotion was unwavering, even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The monotheistic chants echoed through the valley, filling the air with spiritual energy.
